title: MEGATHREAD:  Getting your tech issues with 5.8 resolved!
body:
>**Wrenchmen Program & Respond-a-thon Introduction**

________________________
Heya Summoner, and welcome to the first of hopefully many "Respond-a-thons", hosted by the NA Wrenchmen Program. Before we begin, allow me to introduce what the Wrenchmen Program is and what a Respond-a-thon entails. 

Very briefly, the **Wrenchmen Program** is an international volunteer program, with the purpose of resolving whatever questions we can answer on the Boards, as well as working with Rioters in identifying problems that may be affecting the community at large. If you'd like more information about the Wrenchmen Program, check out Ymir's post on the forums: [The Wrenchmen: Helping Solve Issues, One Post at a Time!](http://forums.eune.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=65139)

A **Respond-a-thon**, on the other hand, is an idea that we had that would allow summoners and Wrenchmen to work on resolving issues in a rapid-response type manner. The underlying concept is that Wrenchmen will be online during the set date(s) and time(s) and regularly checking this thread to work with one another to resolve each issue that summoners experience. 

>**How's this event going to work?**

________________________
When the time/date comes, we'll be posting a new thread where we'll be taking replies where summoners report issues that they're encountering. Hopefully, summoners should be able to find another summoner encountering similar issues and find a resolution to that issue without posting a new reply. We'll do our best to respond as quickly as possible, and to get you back on the rift with minimal hassle.

> **Event Details**
 
________________________
**Date/Time:** Thursday, May 14, 2015 from **7:00PM PDT to 10:00PM PDT** (Wrenchmen will still be resolving questions in the thread after the allotted time; however, you may see a more noticeable delay in those responses.)
**Hosts:** Doctor Elduris (NA Wrenchman), Kao Atlantis (NA Junior Wrenchman), Wuks (NA Junior Wrenchman)
_(Various Rioters may pop in to help out as well)_
 
________________________
Thanks for reading, and we look forward to working with y'alls to quickly resolve any issues that you may be encountering! If you have an account-specific issue, [submit a ticket to Riot Games Player Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to have that issue resolved (remember, we're not Rioters; we're community volunteers). If you have any questions regarding today's event, I'll be happy to respond to any questions, comments, or concerns!

replies.body: i have been having issues with getting the red exclaimation point saying you have been disconnected from pvp.net,it may have been caused by a problem with our service, then it says attempting to reconnect and it does after a split second but it makes it so i cant talk in chats i get random dced  or i dont get que pop up so that i  can hit accept it it quite aggrivating i cant even play the game right now because of it. please help .......

I am having this same issue aswell.  It has never happened before this patch to me.  Its cost me so much LP from dc'ing in champ select to being kick out of games.  Troubleshooting does nothing when the only thing that has changed on my computer is the Client Patch.

i have a solution if you are on a pc.
This worked for me and i was having the same issues.  
Open your run program and run "services.msc" then find ip helper (its in alphabetical order) and disable it
That should fix the problem
FINALLY FIXED! SOMEONE GIVE THIS MAN A COOKIE! {{item:2009}}
thanks :D i feel special but all the credit goes to the random dude in some forum
Random Ping spikes while in game

Hey all,

The Wrenchmen are a really awesome group of players who are incredibly good at identifying and resolving what the issue could be.  

If you have a problem, make sure to post it in this thread so they can help out!

FPS issues after the server crashed after Champion Mastery went live, tried everything in the FPS article on the Support site yet nothing worked.

Happened once earlier a month ago or two when the servers crashed and fps/ping issues persisted for a while but eventually went away.

Hey **Ginnjii**,

Are you still encountering issues related to FPS?

Occasionally. The in-game store lag (an issue I've had for months) feels much worse too.

Not sure if it's related to ping issues that everyone has been complain about the servers going through recently. It hasn't been as frequent until the server crashes a few days ago.

Can you try the solution in the following thread:
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4395065

I'm running a 32-bit WIndows 7 OS though, is it alright? Furthermore, the link http://developer.download.nvidia.com/cg/Cg_3.1/Cg-3.1_April2012_Setup.exe, seems outdated since the libraries are dated 2012? Should I look for a newer version or is this fine as it is?

~~Apparently I need to register to download the library?~~
You'll want to find the latest compatible version!

~~Where exactly?~~

That is the latest release, and they've stopped support for it so it's what I've used. And it doesn't seem to have gotten that better.

Plus I've been experiencing alot of ping spikes, lately.

Heya **Ginnjii**,

If you're having ping spikes, you should check out the [Troubleshooting Connection Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Player Support article! Regarding the store issue, can you check 
> C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\{Current Version}\deploy\preferences

and (MAKE BACKUPS FIRST) delete/rename those files? It'll clear your item sets, which may be causing the problem.

I've done that, referring those articles. ~~I've done it before too. And I've done it again. Infact, I do it every single time I have said ping drops after a server crash. I know it by heart now to the point where I can parrot it out were anyone else who might have ping issues.~~ Even if I do play from Asia, my ping has never been this unstable before, and it fares well with everything else I do online.

As for those files, just to be sure, there's a folder named:
* global

And two files named: 

* Ginnjii.properties
* shared_ginnjii.properties

Those are what you're suggesting I delete, yes?

PS - I don't have item sets.
Those are the files! You can just rename them if you think you may need them later. Can you go to http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/ and paste any issues that it finds here (yellow/red notices)?

I'll do that in a bit.

Whatever those files were deleting them seemed to improve my fps by alot as far as my custom game showed. What exactly happened with regard to those files affecting my fps?

PS - The applet from the site shows a broken link/box instead?

The summoner profile file holds custom item sets, so when the shop loads, it reads those files. 

Regarding the broken link, you can add an exception in your Java settings.

> The round-trip time (RTT) between your computer and our server is 310 ms, which is somewhat high. This may be due to a variety of factors, including distance between your computer and our server, a slow network link, or other network traffic.

^ This makes sense considering I'm playing from Asia and I'm assuming the server the tests took place in is in NA. My ping on League used to be 300ish, and now fluctuates between 350-380.
Gotcha, thanks alot.
PS: On a final note, you should remove the link to the Netalyzr link, as it contains your IP address and other sensitive information!

We'll be hosting another megathread for 5.9, and new threads for each patch that we decide to host an event, effectively closing old megathreads so that it doesn't get too cluttered around here. If you can't ever seem to find or post in a megathread, you can always post a new thread; however, you'll nearly always get a response in a megathread :)

Only one I know of is WTFast and it feels like a lucky grab bag, somedays it's decent, other days I'm better off with my usual ping.

And I think that's all for now. If I have related issues or such, can I just come back here and post? This feels alot more productive and helpful than sending support tickets.

Kewl! So, I mean you could try to use a VPN to reduce your ping, but I'm not sure how much help that'll do. Do you have any additional questions or concerns, or does that answer all of your questions?

Strange thing is I never *had* any custom sets, also, my client seems to be much more responsive now for some odd reason where as earlier there was a slight lag to it.

As for the exception, I added it after enabling NPAPI support since current versions have it disabled which screws with java plugins apparently, and now the entire page is just blank white.
Just replied with the results in this comment thread.
Try http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/cli.html

So I can't seem to login right now. I either get the "Kernel is not Responding" error and my patcher does not open. When it does open, It gets stuck at "Calculating Differences" with 33% complete for a couple hours before I shut it off. I don't really know what is going on but I would appreciate any kind of help. This only started today with the recent events of the patch and I think it may be the cause of it.

Heya **KJtheS**,

Can you try the solution provided in the following Reddit thread:
http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/1lps3z/if_client_is_not_starting_heres_the_fix_enjoy/

I am having an issue with my computer where league of legends has a Visual user interfacing issue where the  login screen and main menu,profile (shop will not even load) go from normal to a black and white skewed version **(refer to image)** the second i hover my mouse over a button and the UI it'self stays in the same location, I am running Windows Vista 32-bit.
PS I also am unable to log into chat services.

Hey Sakimeification! 

Try repairing your client. Click the question mark icon in the top-right corner of your patcher, then click repair to start the repair process.

> [{quoted}](name=Doctor Elduris,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Py1XcAQ0,comment-id=00240000,timestamp=2015-05-09T19:41:30.554+0000)
>
> Hey Sakimeification! 
> 
> Try repairing your client. Click the question mark icon in the top-right corner of your patcher, then click repair to start the repair process.

Tried that, and it laughed at me, still having the same problem, but at least following someone else's  advice helped my no chat connection issue, do you have any other advice for this visual idiocy?

Heya **Sakimeification**,

I'm just checking back in; are you still encountering any issues with the client?
Yes and i tried the suggestion, it failed

Try changing your theme:


1. Open Theme Settings by clicking the Start button, clicking Control Panel, clicking Appearance and Personalization, clicking Personalization, and then clicking Theme.
2. Under Theme, select the theme you want, and then click OK. 

Also, check your graphics control panel for any settings that might be affecting this.
Actually speaking of that the same thing happens in my Nvidia control panel for the sample 3D images, know anything I can do to fix this?
Make sure you have the latest version of your graphics driver first!

I found out the problem but that also lead me to another problem, it's a case of the fact Vista cannot run anything formatted to work and look like an app, Battle.net's launcher, skype and a couple other programs do the same thing, only visually and only on certain menus. the graphics card is upto date and working fine
Are your Nvidia drivers up-to-date?
They are actually a version higher than offered by GeForce's website

So I just re-downloaded the game and the issue I was having prior to the download is still happening which is not being able to log into chat service, thus preventing me from talking during champ select or any other outlet but that being the most important. Is there anything you can inform me of doing?

Heya **LuffyZoroSanji1**,

Riot just resolved an issue regarding the chat services. Can you confirm whether your chat services are functioning properly now?

> [{quoted}](name=Wuks,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Py1XcAQ0,comment-id=00210000,timestamp=2015-05-09T02:43:42.065+0000)
>
> Heya **LuffyZoroSanji1**,
> 
> Riot just resolved an issue regarding the chat services. Can you confirm whether your chat services are functioning properly now?

I'll restart the game and let you know in an edit on this post.

edit: No I've logged on several times now to try and see if they actually fixed it and it doesn't change a thing, still can't connect.

Heya **Rashidos2**,

First, please restart your computer to end any active tasks related to League of Legends. Then, go to
> C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln 

and delete that folder and re-run the client. This'll force a repatch. Try not to end/disrupt the patcher for the duration of the patching process. Thanks!
My patch keeps getting stuck at 33%. I have a MacBook pro

Heya **Koreika**,

There are stages in the patching process where the client will need to move files from one location to another and won't download during these times. Be sure to give the patcher enough time to complete this stage.
At 33%, there have almost been 4,000 files scanned...should it be taking this long?
